Connive.definition: to assent knowingly and wrongfully without opposition to another's wrongdoing ;specif
Connive.origin: [Latin con(n)ivere to close one's eyes, knowingly overlook something]

con·niv·ing.definition: [Latinto close one's eyes, knowingly overlook something]to assent knowingly and wrongfully without opposition to another's wrongdoingto knowingly consent to a spouse's marital misconduct and esp. to adultery
